CTreeViewControl

A TreeView control.

This control extends CControl.  All basic properties and functions are implemented and documented in this class.

Summary
CTreeViewControlA TreeView control.
Functions
FindItemFinds an item by its ID.
FindItemWithTextFinds an item by its text.
Properties
ItemsContains the nodes of the tree.
SelectedItemContains the node of type CItem that is currently selected.
PreviouslySelectedItemContains the node of type CItem that was previously selected.
Events
Introduction1) Use an event handler.
Click(Item)Invoked when the user clicked on the control.
DoubleClick(Item)Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.
RightClick(Item)Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.
EditingStart(Item)Invoked when the user started editing a node.
EditingEnd(Item)Invoked when the user finished editing a node.
ItemSelected(Item)Invoked when the user selected a node.
ItemExpanded(Item)Invoked when the user expanded a node.
ItemCollapsed(Item)Invoked when the user collapsed a node.
KeyPress(KeyCode)Invoked when the user pressed a key while the control was focused.
CTreeViewControl.CItemA tree node.
Functions
AddAdds a new item to the TreeView.
AddControlAdds a control to this tree node that will be visible only when this node is selected.
DeleteDeletes an item.
MoveMoves an Item to another position.
SetIconSets the icon of a tree node
MaxIndexReturns the number of child nodes.
ItemByIDAccess a child item by its ID.
FindItemWithTextFinds a child item by its Text.
Properties
1,2,3,4,...The child nodes of a tree node may be accessed by their index, e.g.
CheckedItemsAn array containing all checked child nodes of type CTreeViewControl.CItem.
CheckedIndicesAn array containing all checked child indices.
ParentThe parent node of this node.
IDThe ID used internally in the TreeView control.
IconThe path of an icon assigned to this node.
IconNumberThe icon number used when an icon file contains more than one icon.
CountThe number of child nodes.
HasChildrenTrue if there is at least one child node.
TextThe text of this tree node.
CheckedTrue if the tree node is checked.
SelectedTrue if the tree node is selected.
ExpandedTrue if the tree node is expanded.
BoldIf true, the text of this node is bold.

Functions

FindItem

FindItem(ID,  
Root =  "")

Finds an item by its ID.

Parameters

IDThe ID of the item.

FindItemWithText

FindItemWithText(Text,  
Root =  "")

Finds an item by its text.

Parameters

TextThe text of the item.

Properties

Items

Contains the nodes of the tree.  Each level can be iterated and indexed.  A node is of type CTreeViewControl.CItem

SelectedItem

Contains the node of type CItem that is currently selected.

PreviouslySelectedItem

Contains the node of type CItem that was previously selected.

Events

Introduction

There are currently 3 methods to handle control events

1) Use an event handler.  Simply use control.EventName.Handler := “HandlingFunction” Instead of “HandlingFunction” it is also possible to pass a function reference or a Delegate: control.EventName.Handler := new Delegate(Object, “HandlingFunction”) If this method is used, the first parameter will contain the control object that sent this event.

2) Create a function with this naming scheme in your window class: ControlName_EventName(params)

3) Instead of using ControlName_EventName() you may also call CControl.RegisterEvent on a control instance to register a different event function name.  This method is deprecated since event handlers are more flexible.

The parameters depend on the event and there may not be params at all in some cases.

Click(Item)

Invoked when the user clicked on the control.

DoubleClick(Item)

Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.

RightClick(Item)

Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.

EditingStart(Item)

Invoked when the user started editing a node.

EditingEnd(Item)

Invoked when the user finished editing a node.

ItemSelected(Item)

Invoked when the user selected a node.

ItemExpanded(Item)

Invoked when the user expanded a node.

ItemCollapsed(Item)

Invoked when the user collapsed a node.

KeyPress(KeyCode)

Invoked when the user pressed a key while the control was focused.

A tree node.

Functions

Add

Add(Text,  
Options =  "")

Adds a new item to the TreeView.

Parameters

TextThe text of the item.
OptionsVarious options, see Autohotkey TreeView documentation

Returns

An object of type CItem representing the newly added item.

AddControl

AddControl(type,  
Name,  
Options,  
Text,  
UseEnabledState =  0)

Adds a control to this tree node that will be visible only when this node is selected.  The parameters correspond to the Add() function of CGUI.

Parameters

TypeThe type of the control.
NameThe name of the control.
OptionsOptions used for creating the control.
TextThe text of the control.
UseEnabledStateIf true, the control will be enabled/disabled instead of visible/hidden.

Delete

Delete(ObjectOrIndex)

Deletes an item.

Parameters

ObjectOrIndexThe item object or the index of the child item of this.

Move

Move(Position = 1,
Parent =  "")

Moves an Item to another position.

Parameters

PositionThe new (one-based) - position in the child items of Parent.
ParentThe item will be inserted as child of the Parent item.  Leave empty to use its current parent.

SetIcon

SetIcon(Filename,  
IconNumberOrTransparencyColor =  1)

Sets the icon of a tree node

Parameters

FilenameThe filename of the file containing the icon.
IconNumberOrTransparencyColorThe icon number or the transparency color if the used file has no transparency support.

MaxIndex

MaxIndex()

Returns the number of child nodes.

ItemByID

Access a child item by its ID.

Parameters

IDThe ID of the child item

FindItemWithText

FindItemWithText(Text)

Finds a child item by its Text.

Parameters

TextThe text of the child item

Properties

1,2,3,4,...

The child nodes of a tree node may be accessed by their index, e.g. this.TreeView1.Items[1][2][3].Text := “AHK”

CheckedItems

An array containing all checked child nodes of type CTreeViewControl.CItem.

CheckedIndices

An array containing all checked child indices.

Parent

The parent node of this node.

ID

The ID used internally in the TreeView control.

Icon

The path of an icon assigned to this node.

IconNumber

The icon number used when an icon file contains more than one icon.

Count

The number of child nodes.

HasChildren

True if there is at least one child node.

Text

The text of this tree node.

Checked

True if the tree node is checked.

Selected

True if the tree node is selected.

Expanded

True if the tree node is expanded.

Bold

If true, the text of this node is bold.
